Pinyin is the system of symbols for the phonetic notation of all Chinese characters. Each Chinese character has its own syllable, and each syllable is composed of three parts, i.e initials, finals and tones. This will help you improve your pronunciation of Chinese Mandarin.
An initial is a consonant. It is always at the very beginning of a syllable, if there is only one it cannot exist by itself.In total there are 23 initial consonants
Finals are mostly vowels, or start with a vowel, in a Chinese Pinyin Syllable , the final goes at the very end. There are 6 simple finals, 13 compound finals and 16 nasal finals.
A simple final is a vowel. The six simple finals are the most fundamental elements in pinyin.
By combining the simple finals with each other , we can make 14 compound finals.
By combining the simple finals with "n" or "ng", we can make 16 nasal finals

Chinese is a tonal language. In order to differentiate meanings , the same syllable can be pronounced with different tones, which are marked with a little symbol above the vowel, and one neutral tone. Each tone has a distinctive pitch contour which can be graphed using the Chinese five-level system.

The first tone is a flat tone. When we pronounce it, we have to keep our voice at a very high pitch and flat throughout the whole syllable. The tone mark to represent the flat tone is a horizontal line.
The second tone is a Rising Tone. when we pronounce it, we start our voice in the middle of the tone and go up. The tone mark is represented by a rising line.
The third tone is a Falling-Rising Tone. When we pronounce it, the pitch of our voice goes down first then goes up . It is represented by a curved "dipping" line.
The Fourth Tone is a Falling Tone. When we pronounce it, starts our voice at a high pitch but sharply drops to the bottom. The fourth tone is represented by a dropping line.
